    • Field Detail

      • ACTION_REGISTER

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_REGISTER
        Action to be used to register an Expression with an Intent. Registration should preferably be done with the registerExpression(Context, String, Expression, ExpressionListener) , registerTriStateExpression(Context, String, TriStateExpression, TriStateExpressionListener) , registerValueExpression(Context, String, ValueExpression, ValueExpressionListener) convenience methods.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_UNREGISTER

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_UNREGISTER
        Action to be used to unregister an Expression with an Intent. Unregistration should preferably be done with the unregisterExpression(Context, String) convenience method.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_NEW_VALUES

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_NEW_VALUES
        Action to filter on with a broadcast receiver that indicates the arrival of new values for a ValueExpression. The ValueExpressionListener already listens to these broadcasts and forwards them to the listener.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_NEW_TRISTATE

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_NEW_TRISTATE
        Action to filter on with a broadcast receiver that indicates the arrival of a new tristate for a TristateExpression. The TristateExpressionListener already listens to these broadcasts and forwards them to the listener.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_NEW_VALUES

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_NEW_VALUES
        The extra key that contains the Parcelable[] with the new TimestampedValues. Cast the array items one by one, rather than the entire array, since this will throw a ClassCastException.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_NEW_TRISTATE

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_NEW_TRISTATE
        The extra key that contains the new TriState.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_NEW_TRISTATE_TIMESTAMP

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_NEW_TRISTATE_TIMESTAMP
        The extra key that contains the timestamp of when the evaluation resulting in the TriState happened.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE
        The extra key that can be used with registerExpression(Context, String, Expression, Intent, Intent, Intent, Intent) intents to indicate what type the intents are. Possible values are INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY, INTENT_TYPE_BROADCAST (default), INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTENT_TYPE_BROADCAST

        public static final java.lang.String INTENT_TYPE_BROADCAST
        Extra value for key EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE that indicates that the intent should be broadcast
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY

        public static final java.lang.String INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY
        Extra value for key EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE that indicates that the intent should start an activity
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE

        public static final java.lang.String INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE
        Extra value for key EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE that indicates that the intent should start a service
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getSensors

        public static java.util.List<SensorInfo> getSensors(android.content.Context context)
        Returns all the information about the sensors known to SWAN. These are sensors both from within the SWAN framework and 3rd party sensors.
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        List of information per known sensor.

      • getSensor

        public static SensorInfo getSensor(android.content.Context context,
                   java.lang.String name)
                            throws SwanException
        Returns the information about a sensor with a specific name or throws a SwanException if the sensor is not installed on the device.
        Parameters:
        context -
        name - the entity name of the sensor
        Returns:
        The sensor information
        Throws:
        SwanException

      • registerTriStateExpression

        public static void registerTriStateExpression(android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.String id,
                              TriStateExpression expression,
                              TriStateExpressionListener listener)
                                       throws SwanException
        Registers a TriStateExpression for evaluation.
        Parameters:
        context -
        id - the user provided unique id of the expression. Should not contain Expression.SEPARATOR or end with any of the Expression.RESERVED_SUFFIXES.
        expression - the TriStateExpression that should be evaluated
        listener - a TriStateExpressionListener that receives the evaluation results. If this parameter is null, it is also possible to listen for the results using a BroadcastReceiver. Filter on datascheme "swan://#" and action ACTION_NEW_TRISTATE.
        Throws:
        SwanException - if id is null or invalid

      • registerValueExpression

        public static void registerValueExpression(android.content.Context context,
                           java.lang.String id,
                           ValueExpression expression,
                           ValueExpressionListener listener)
                                    throws SwanException
        Registers a ValueExpression for evaluation.
        Parameters:
        context -
        id - the user provided unique id of the expression. Should not contain Expression.SEPARATOR or end with any of the Expression.RESERVED_SUFFIXES.
        expression - the ValueExpression that should be evaluated
        listener - a ValueExpressionListener that receives the evaluation results. If this parameter is null, it is also possible to listen for the results using a BroadcastReceiver. Filter on datascheme "swan://#" and action ACTION_NEW_VALUES.
        Throws:
        SwanException - if id is null or invalid

      • registerExpression

        public static void registerExpression(android.content.Context context,
                      java.lang.String id,
                      Expression expression,
                      ExpressionListener expressionListener)
                               throws SwanException
        Registers an Expression for evaluation.
        Parameters:
        context -
        id - the user provided unique id of the expression. Should not contain Expression.SEPARATOR or end with any of the Expression.RESERVED_SUFFIXES.
        expression - the ValueExpression that should be evaluated
        listener - a ValueExpressionListener that receives the evaluation results. If this parameter is null, it is also possible to listen for the results using a BroadcastReceiver. Filter on datascheme "swan://#" and action ACTION_NEW_VALUES or ACTION_NEW_TRISTATE.
        Throws:
        SwanException - if id is null or invalid

      • registerTriStateExpression

        public static void registerTriStateExpression(android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.String id,
                              TriStateExpression expression,
                              android.content.Intent onTrue,
                              android.content.Intent onFalse,
                              android.content.Intent onUndefined)
        Registers a TriStateExpression for evaluation.
        Parameters:
        context -
        id - the user provided unique id of the expression. Should not contain Expression.SEPARATOR or end with any of the Expression.RESERVED_SUFFIXES.
        expression - the TriStateExpression that should be evaluated
        onTrue - Intent that should be fired when state changes to true. By default the Intent is used to send a broadcast. Add EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE with any of the values INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY, INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE to have Swan launch an activity or service.
        onFalse - Intent that should be fired when state changes to false. By default the Intent is used to send a broadcast. Add EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE with any of the values INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY, INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE to have Swan launch an activity or service.
        onUndefined - Intent that should be fired when state changes to undefined. By default the Intent is used to send a broadcast. Add EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE with any of the values INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY, INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE to have Swan launch an activity or service.

      • registerValueExpression

        public static void registerValueExpression(android.content.Context context,
                           java.lang.String id,
                           TriStateExpression expression,
                           android.content.Intent onNewValues)
        Registers a ValueExpression for evaluation.
        Parameters:
        context -
        id - the user provided unique id of the expression. Should not contain Expression.SEPARATOR or end with any of the Expression.RESERVED_SUFFIXES.
        expression - the ValueExpression that should be evaluated
        onNewValues - Intent that should be fired when new values are available. Add EXTRA_INTENT_TYPE with any of the values INTENT_TYPE_ACTIVITY, INTENT_TYPE_SERVICE to have Swan launch an activity or service.

      • unregisterExpression

        public static void unregisterExpression(android.content.Context context,
                        java.lang.String id)
        Unregisters a previously registered Expression for evaluation.
        Parameters:
        context -
        id - the id with which the expression was registered.
